reviewText: Adorable, This is a lovely tale about God, about the reality of Death, about the complexity of Love. As usual, even when topics are serious, Eric-Emmanuel Schmidt lights up his story with a "bon enfant" philosophy, which helps remember that happiness depends mostly on the way we take what life sends us. This is one of these books that you cannot ever forget, and it reads easily, with delight.
a little different from the book, however very moving story. My students loved watching it (AP class).
it was funny, sad, adorable, amazing, and beautiful. I enjoyed it very much
Excellent DVD.  Will show at one of our movie evenings during the coming school year.

to me this was an overlooked masterpiece.  the fantasy parts are beautifully produced -- psychedelic more or less.  the writing is poetic and moving and the end heartbreaking and healing.

too bad never released in usa
